content.question: Consumer surplus in a market for a good exists because

choices.label: binding price floors encourage producers to increase the supply of the good
some consumers would be willing to pay more than the equilibrium price of the good
when the price of the good decreases, most consumers increase their demand for the good
producers do not have market power to set their own price
some producers charge different prices for the good in different markets

content.answer: some consumers would be willing to pay more than the equilibrium price of the good

topic.text: 2.6: Market Equilibrium and Consumer and Producer Surplus

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Describe economic concepts, principles, or models.
